title: Logistics Terms
description: Deliver your best performance on this quiz about shipping, warehousing, and supply chain vocabulary.

questions.question: What does 'FOB' stand for in shipping?
What is a 'bill of lading'?
options: A legal document issued by a carrier detailing the type, quantity, and destination of goods being shipped

questions.question: What does 'just-in-time' (JIT) inventory mean?
options: A strategy where materials arrive precisely when needed in production, minimizing storage costs
Ordering extra inventory in case of emergencies
Delivering goods at the last possible moment

questions.question: What is a 'pallet' in logistics?
options: A flat transport structure used to support goods for storage and shipping, often moved by forklifts

questions.question: What does 'drayage' refer to?
options: Dragging heavy cargo across a dock
The transport of goods over a short distance, typically from a port to a warehouse

questions.question: What is 'cross-docking'?
options: Parking two trucks side by side
Loading goods from both sides of a truck
A logistics practice where incoming goods are directly transferred to outgoing vehicles with minimal storage

questions.question: What does 'TEU' stand for?
options: Twenty-foot Equivalent Unit, a standard measure for shipping container capacity

questions.question: What is 'demurrage'?
options: A charge for keeping a shipping container or vessel beyond the allowed free time

questions.question: What does 'last mile delivery' refer to?
options: The final leg of the delivery process from a distribution center to the end customer
The final mile of a highway

questions.question: What is a 'manifest' in shipping?
options: A document listing all cargo, passengers, and crew on a vessel or vehicle

questions.question: What does 'LTL' stand for in freight shipping?
What is 'reverse logistics'?
options: The process of moving goods from the customer back to the seller or manufacturer for returns, recycling, or disposal
Shipping goods backwards through the supply chain

questions.question: What is 'intermodal transport'?
options: The use of two or more modes of transport (truck, rail, ship) to move goods in a single journey

questions.question: What does 'lead time' mean in logistics?
options: The time it takes to load a truck
The first delivery of the day
The time the lead driver takes a break
The total time from placing an order to receiving the goods
